runs.comm: back of a length outside off, Tamim stays back and defends to the off side
that trademark pull from Tamim, did not take too long to unfurl that one, though this was not short enough, and hence it went down to mid off, he was quite late on the shot
back of a length on middle and leg, he can't get it away through the leg side
drifts on to Tamim's pads, he hops back and works it away towards midwicket to get going
beauty from Aamer! Short of a length, pace, bounce and movement. It did everything except take Kayes' tentative outside edge. Cricket is that kind of game!

and he does not have to wait long to have his man! Great over finishes with a great result, as Aamer keeps it short of a length and straight, Kayes looks to pull despite not having the length and the top edge balloons up towards short third man where it is held by Misbah running back from slip
angles across Tamim, cramping him for room
shot! A fraction of width outside off, Tamim smacks his lips and then smacks the ball, cross batted, just wide of mid off. It flew away!
hops back in his crease and pulls well this time into the deep to give strike to Ashraful
length outside off, draws Ashraful forward and he defends down the track
nicely played, stayed back and picked the line early to swivel pull it in the air, lands safely and runs to the fielder at long leg

Tamim perfects the pull on the third attempt! He looks majestic when he does that, hopping on one foot and turning his hips and upper body into the shot, and sending it crashing behind square on the leg
on off stump, opens the face and runs it to point
angles across Ashraful, who rides the bounce and then opens the face to send it down to third man
very low full toss outside leg, it had Tamim in a tangle and he fell over as it landed on his toes. Waqar in the dug-out must be happy with that
good follow up ball too - shortens the length and catches Tamim in two minds, he keeps it away in ungainly fashion
and goes for the yorker again, Tamim gets marginally forward and drives back to the bowler. This is lovely bowling.
tight single, short of a length outside off and Tamim is desperate to get something out of the over so he runs across. Direct his might have made things interesting.
full on leg, driven well seeking the gap between mid on and midwicket, but the latter puts in the slide to stop the ball
that's the kind of shot that makes people rave about Ashraful! Marginally short outside off, the short man rides thre bounce, stands tall and cuts it majestically behind square
straighter this time, and Ashraful gives it the respect it deserves. Tapped back down to the bowler
Sami's radar is a little awry. Ashraful was committed to the paddle shot, but gave up when he realised how wide it was going

and this then is why Ashraful continues to disappoint his fans. Second time in two balls he tries to be cheeky, walking all over the crease and looking to make something out of nothing in dangerous fashion
opens the face this time and runs it down to third man to turn it over to Tamim.
goes for the pull again, and gets a top edge that goes high and well behind the keeper's head. No one under it when it lands and they get a brace
back of a length outside off, and timing conspicuous by its absence as Ashraful looks to cover drive
very full on leg stump, Tamim does well to dig it out, down the ground for a single
a loud noise as that ball passed Ashraful's outside edge, eliciting a stifled appeal. Replays suggest it was bat hitting the ground
tucks him up on leg stump this time, quietly played away to midwicket

Smoked down the ground! Attempted yorker, misses its spot by inches and ends up overpitched on leg stump, Tamim was waiting for it, cleared his front foot and drove through the vacant long on area for a pleasing boundary
Aamer makes up the inches this time - perfect yorker on leg and Tamim can't do much with it
fastish off spin, coming into Ashraful who gets forward and blocks
drifts down leg this time and Ashraful misses the sweep.
reverse paddled straight to short third man where Aamer fumbles. Quick single taken.

soft dismissal, soft as a baby's bottom! And a huge scalp too, Tamim is gone here. Fligted ball outside off, Tamim was into the check drive early and it popped back in the air to Hafeez who was celebrating before he completed the catch.
tight line and length on middle and off, defended off back foot
Shakib jumps across to the offside and pulls out the lap shot to get off the mark

very deft little sweep shot this time, from the leg stump line, and he sent it very fine. It was a battle of attrition between the fine leg fielder and the ball, the ball blinked first and almost stopped before reaching the rope
length ball on off stump, driven down to long off for one
tight line, on a length outside off, Ashraful runs it down behind square for a single
back of a length, angling across Shakib who stays back and defends to the off side
slower ball on Shakib's pads, he waits and plays the pull, it goes down fine
educated edge just wide of the keeper Akmal, who put a surprisingly low-key effort. A big dive was possibly in order, but it ran away for four
and he picks another single towards the off side to finish the over
was that a drop from Kamran? short of a length, Shakib can't connect with the flick but possibly got a thick inside edge, and Kamran put it down
works it down to the leg side for one
why oh why does Ashraful play these shots? Unnecessary risky reverse paddle up in the air just over the short third man fielder
unnecessary sweep this time and he misses again, survives a close lbw shout as well
played away between midwicket and square leg
and he shows just exactly why those shots in the previous over were stupid - awesome AWESOME swing of the hands to deposit Razzaq's not-so-bad ball over midwicket. Top stuff!
and as is his wont, another infuriating pre-meditated shot for no runs again.
hig fulltoss, called a no ball for height. Ashraful keeps his wits about him and pulls down to square leg
shortens the length, Shakib waits and works it away to the leg side
down the track, frees his arms and looks to go downtown over the off side, but he can't connect it so well. Runs through for a couple
opens the face of the bat and guides it down to third man

excellent shot from Shakib, knowing where the fielders are and picking his spot! Long on was vacant, and Shakib knew it was safe if he could clear the infield. He did better with the length ball and drove it well with a straight bat, it landed just short of the ropes
drifting on middle and leg, worked away for one
turn for Ajmal from short of a length, Shakib keeps it away off back foot
turns away from middle and off, worked straight to the man at cover
drifts down this time and Shakib exacts full toll! Waits and nurdles it fine, using the pace of the ball to send it away for four.
straighter this time, and Shakib plays it with respect
another good ball, it was a good over over-all from Ajmal despite that boundary, once again operating on the tight leash, short of a length on off and middle ripping it across Shakib
What a shot! Flighted leggie outside off, in Ashraful's slot, he got forward and drove it handsomely over cover.
fullish again outside off, driven between cover and point this time for a single
big googly this time, Shakib fails to read it, and misses the slog sweep
goes for the sweep again, and top edges it this time, but it does not carry to long leg
another cheeky reverse paddle from Ashraful, tough to comprehend that shot given the presence of short third man, and it goes straight to that fielder again
cut away from off stump line for a single towards deep cover
looks to deflect it fine and late, but it comes in with the turn and he taps it to point for a single
played away to short third man
another timely boundary from Shakib, picked his spot once again and pinged the straight boundary off the length ball. Did well to play with a straight bat
pull-sweep this time off middle and leg, and they scamper for a couple
swept high in the air, towards square leg, but it lands well in, the fielder slides to save a couple
WoW, take a bow Ashraful! Incredibly well-timed off drive over long off, he barely swished the bat at that, with half a backlift and even lesser of follow through, and it landed high over long off!
drives along gthe ground this time through the off side for a couple
can't get runs this time, looks to get it away to the leg side
tries to get cheeky, opening the face but cannot connect
and again, he tees away with a brilliant extra-cover drive off the front foot, bisecting the gap between long off and deep cover for four.
bunts it powerfully down the ground for a single. Is this the day for Ashraful to come to the party?
expert placement, he chipped it straight down the ground and he always has two there. A fine fifty for Ashraful.
drives down to long on this time to turn the strike over
Shakib gets into the act this time, with a robus slog sweep over wide long on. Bangladesh are giving this a go!
driven down to long off for a single
lofted on the bounce straight to long off

The skipper does it again, even longer this time over long on. Very hittable lengths on offer and Shakib's played risk-free cricket today, picking the right balls to hit. This again was one of them and the slog sweep landed well beyond long on
driven powerfully past the bowler towards long off
opens up the off side and goes aerial, it lands in no mans land at extra cover. Two more
worked away off the pads to midwicket, where there is a misfield and they get two more!
drives in the air towards long off, the field is so big that these are not carrying to the deep!
nice loopy leggie outside off, decieves Ashraful all ends up, and he does well not to edge the cut
Heave ho to the short ball outside off, gets a thick edge with the attempted pull and it runs fine towards third man

and gone! Sami's struck a crucial blow and Shakib, who's run very hard for his runs in the recent past, has possible lost his wicket to tiredness. He could not pack a punch into that lofted drive over the off side and it went straight to long off. Good ball from Sami, denying him the length to drive comfortably.
short of a length outside off, Ashraful gets forward and works it behind point. He holds the key for Bangladesh
dropped by Kamran Akmal! Thickish inside edge that darted in, and Kamran had to regroup and dive to his left. In the end, he did well to stop what would have been a sure four
good yorker on off, dug out straight to the bowler

and Mahmudullah goes, without contributing anything! Slower ball wide of off stump this time, he looks to slash it over point, but gets neither timing or placement. The dolly goes straight down point's lap. Bangladesh have lost two big sticks to Sami.
normal service continues for Ashraful! What a shot amidst the clatter of wickets, full outside off stump, and he drives high over long off
opens the face this time and goes inside out over the covers
looks to run this down to third man, it goes straight to short third man who promptly concedes an over throw
another late cut, straight to Ajmal at short third man, and they get the single
gets forward and drives to mid on for a single that will deny Ashraful strike for the first ball of the next over
great shot under pressure! Islam comes down the track, opens the off side and slashes over point for a crucial boundary
can't make contact this time though. Looks to go over the off side again, he should try and turn the strike
another awry shot, he walks down the track and ends up too far from the full ball outside off and falls over as he tries to make contact.
stupendous yorker this time from Aamer, and this time Islam manages to get it down to mid on for a single. Two balls, what can Ashraful do?

well, he can get himself out, that's what! Ashraful lives by the sword, and also dies by the sword. Maybe the situation now needed him to manufacture a boundary, he hopped across towards off stump to look for a fine lap or pull shot, but it went too fine this time. Kamran, who's put down a couple, dives to his left and takes a beauty
hoicked down to long on for a single. Great recovery this over from Aamer after conceding four of the first ball, and one suspects Bangladesh have lost their last chance
Full on leg and middle, somehow squeezed down to fine leg, where Hafeez puts in a wonderful dive to save a run
driven without  much power to cover, for a single. Bangladesh needs to find the ropes

and another one bites the dust! Cool, calm death bowling and Bangladesh's batsmen are doing the rest as the noose tightens. This was short of a length on middle and the batsman goes for the swipe over the leg side, gets a top edge which balloons up to midwicket
drives hard wide of mid off to turn the strike over
good yorker to Mortaza, who can only feebly dig it out to mid on for a single
another near-perfect yorker, the batsman cannot connect well with the attempted scoop shot
slides down the leg, Akmal appeals for a catch down the leg, it may have made contact too, but Asoka de Silva calls wide
full this time, and driven down to long on
shortens the length and gets turn and bounce from outside off. Mortaza swings and misses
sells him the dummy this time! Mortaza is down the track, but well short of the pitch of the ball, which slips past him and into Akmal's gloves who gleefully whips off the bails
shades of Saqlain, the tail-ender Shuvo has no clue what it is doing and misses the zipping offies, with his across-the-linbe hoicks
refer to the commentary for the previous ball - this was an action replay
fuller this time, finally gets bat on ball towards cover and he gets a single. Pakistan have won!
